title: Merge LeadMagnetSection into StrategyCallSection as 3-box single-row layout

requirements.summary: Rewrite StrategyCallSection to display a single-row layout with three side-by-side boxes: Box 1 (Schedule Your Call with Calendly placeholder and CTA buttons), Box 2 (Send a Message contact form), and Box 3 (7 Profit Killers lead magnet with email capture). All boxes use glassmorphism card styling with gold borders. On mobile, boxes stack vertically. Section heading and supporting text remain at the top. Retain section background (#0D1526) and gold accent top border.
acceptanceCriteria: StrategyCallSection displays three boxes side-by-side in a single row on desktop
Box 1 contains the Calendly placeholder, Schedule Call Now button (href: https://calendly.com/your-link), and WhatsApp button (href: https://wa.me/918766936874)
Box 2 contains the contact form with Name, Email, Amazon Store URL fields and Send Message button with existing submission success state
Box 3 contains the 7 Profit Killers description, email capture form, Get Free PDF button, and success message state
All three boxes use glassmorphism card styling with gold borders consistent with the site design system
On mobile, the three boxes stack vertically in order (Box 1, Box 2, Box 3)
Section heading and supporting text remain visible at the top of the section
Section background (#0D1526) and gold accent top border are retained
All existing icons, styling, and form functionality are preserved — no content is lost

file_operations.description: Replace the current two-column layout with a new single-row flexbox/grid layout containing three side-by-side boxes. Box 1: Merge the existing Calendly placeholder (bordered box with 'Calendly scheduling widget will appear here'), the gold 'Schedule Call Now' CTA button (href: https://calendly.com/your-link), and the green WhatsApp 'Chat on WhatsApp' button (href: https://wa.me/918766936874) from the current left column. Box 2: Preserve the existing contact form with Name, Email, and Amazon Store URL fields plus the 'Send Message' submit button and success state from the current right column. Box 3: Import and integrate the full content from LeadMagnetSection.tsx including the '7 Profit Killers in Amazon PPC' heading, description text ('Discover the 7 most common mistakes that drain Amazon PPC budgets — and how to fix them. Download your free guide now.'), email input field, gold 'Get Free PDF' CTA button, and the success message state on submit. Apply glassmorphism card styling (glass-effect class or equivalent with backdrop-blur, rgba background, and gold border accent) to all three boxes, matching the existing design system. Use responsive layout classes (e.g., flex flex-col lg:flex-row gap-8) so boxes stack vertically on mobile and align horizontally on desktop. Retain the section heading 'Book Your Free 30-Minute Amazon Growth Strategy Call' and supporting text at the top of the section. Preserve the section's slightly lighter background (#0D1526) and gold accent top border. Ensure all useState hooks for form submission states are preserved for both Box 2 and Box 3. Maintain all existing icons (CheckCircle, Calendar, MessageSquare, Download, etc.) and their imports.

requirements.summary: Remove the standalone LeadMagnetSection component from App.tsx (currently positioned after ComparisonSection) and remove its import. Also remove the adjacent SectionConnector instance to avoid orphaned connectors.
acceptanceCriteria: LeadMagnetSection is no longer rendered anywhere in App.tsx
The LeadMagnetSection import is removed from App.tsx
The SectionConnector that was adjacent to LeadMagnetSection is removed so no orphaned connector remains
The page flow reads: ... ComparisonSection → SectionConnector → StrategyCallSection (with no LeadMagnetSection in between)
No visual gap or broken layout appears where LeadMagnetSection previously existed

file_operations.description: Remove the LeadMagnetSection import statement from the top of the file. Locate the JSX block where LeadMagnetSection is currently rendered (after ComparisonSection) and remove both the <LeadMagnetSection /> component and the SectionConnector instance immediately adjacent to it (either before or after) to prevent an orphaned connector in the page flow. Verify that the remaining section order reads: ... ComparisonSection, SectionConnector, StrategyCallSection, ... with no gaps or duplicate connectors. Ensure no other references to LeadMagnetSection remain in the file.
